description: Go runtime metrics from OpenTelemetry provider.

panels.description: The number of OS threads that can execute user-level Go code simultaneously.
panels.title: Processor Limit

panels.description:
Interpretation:

~0 → healthy

Slowly positive → leak

Sudden spike → burst fan-out or stuck workers
panels.title: Goroutine leak detection

panels.description: Memory used by the Go runtime.
panels.title: Memory Used

panels.description: Memory used by the Go runtime.
panels.title: Stack Memory Used

panels.description: Heap size target for the end of the GC cycle.
panels.title: Memory GC Goal

panels.description: Memory allocated to the heap by the application.
panels.title: Memory Allocated

panels.description: Heap size target percentage configured by the user, otherwise 100.
panels.title: Heap Size Target

panels.description: High count + low bytes = lots of tiny allocations → classic Go perf smell.
panels.title: Objects allocated per second

title: Go Runtime
